868.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   “Dispatching service” means a person who receives telephone calls, or
similar communication, from the public requesting taxicab service and then, by
means of a two-way radio, or similar communication, transmits such requests to
taxicabs with which he or she has a contract to provide these services.
   (b)   “Driver” means the driver of a licensed taxicab.
   (c)   “Holder” means the person to whom a taxicab license has been issued
under the terms of this chapter.
   (d)   “Livery” means a privately owned first division vehicle which is
intended to be used for the transportation of persons when the payment is not
based on a meter charge but is prearranged for a designated destination. Except
as provided expressly to the contrary herein, livery vehicles shall meet all of
the same requirements as imposed upon taxicabs in this chapter. A “livery”
vehicle shall not include “medical carrier” vehicle as that term is defined
below. Livery shall not include any first division vehicle used for the
transportation of persons based on a prearranged charge for a designated
destination if fifty-one percent of the passenger-determined destinations which
commence within the City of Freeport and terminate at a point outside of the
corporate limits of the City of Freeport.
   (e)   “Medical carrier” means or any privately owned first or second
division motor vehicle which is intended to be used for, and is maintained or
operated for, the non-emergency transportation of persons for medical purposes
or services.
   (f)   “Operate” means the offering of any taxicab to the public for the
purpose of carrying passengers for hire.
   (g)   “Operator” means the owner of the taxicab, as distinguished from the
driver of the taxicab.
   (h)   “Taxicab” means any vehicle used or offered to be used to carry six or
fewer passengers at any one time for hire to a passenger-designated
destination, but this term shall not include any livery vehicle or any medical
carrier vehicle as defined above nor any motor vehicles regulated by the
Illinois Commerce Commission.
(Ord. 99-18. Passed 4-19-99; Ord. 2011-51. Passed 10-3-11; Ord. 2016-11. Passed
2-16-16.)
868.02 TAXICAB LICENSES.
   (a)   Required. No person shall operate or permit a taxicab owned or
controlled by him or her to be operated as a taxicab on the streets of the City
without first obtaining a valid and current taxicab license for that vehicle,
issued in his or her name, from the City.
   (b)   Application; Falsification. Every applicant for a taxicab license
shall truthfully and fully complete, under oath or affirmation, one copy of an
application for a taxicab license, which application shall be available, at a
cost of twenty dollars ($20.00), at the office of the City Clerk. The
applicant's inclusion of false or misleading information on this application
shall be grounds for suspension or revocation of the taxicab license. Each
vehicle to be licensed as a taxicab shall have a separate application
completed. The application for a taxicab license, in addition to the standard
application requirements listed elsewhere in this chapter, shall contain:
      (1)   The vehicle identification number of the vehicle, and a complete
description of the vehicle, including the make, model, year or production,
color and the motor and serial numbers of the vehicle;
      (2)   A statement by the applicant that he or she has complied with the
applicable provisions of the Illinois Vehicle Code, as amended, pertaining to
the operation of a motor vehicle for the carriage of passengers for hire;
      (3)   A statement by the applicant that he or she is the owner of the
vehicle described in the application, and further listing all other persons
possessing or claiming an ownership interest in the vehicle, as well as the
existence of any liens against such vehicle;
      (4)   The financial status of the applicant, including the amounts of all
unpaid judgments against the applicant and the nature of the transactions or
acts giving rise to these judgments;
      (5)   The experience of the applicant in the transportation of
passengers;
      (6)   A copy of a properly executed contract between the applicant and a
taxi dispatching service licensed under the provisions of this chapter for the
providing of such services to the applicant's vehicle should the taxicab
license be issued; and
      (7)   Such other and further information as the License Officer may
require.
   The failure of the applicant to provide the information required above shall
render the taxicab license application incomplete, and the License Officer
shall not issue any taxicab license until all such items are filed with the
City.
   (c)   Vehicles to be Licensed Separately. A separate taxicab license shall
be issued for each vehicle, and all licenses issued shall be numbered
consecutively, as determined by the date and time of issuance.
   (d)   Inspection Stickers or Decals. No operator shall permit a taxicab to
be operated if such taxicab does not have affixed to it a current and valid
sticker or decal issued by the City. The sticker or decal shall be furnished by
the City for display on the right upper corner of the rear window of the
taxicab. Such sticker or decal shall be of such size and shape, and shall
contain such insignias thereon, as shall be required by this chapter or by the
City's License Officer acting pursuant thereto. The sticker or decal shall be
affixed to the taxicab only by authorized agents of the City, only after the
taxicab has successfully passed a safety inspection and only after the License
Officer has issued a valid and current taxicab license for that taxicab. The
sticker or decal shall be valid through June 30 of each year and may be renewed
as provided in this section.
   (e)   Fees. The annual taxicab license fee shall be as follows:
      (1)   For the first vehicle: twenty-five dollars ($25.00);
      (2)   For each additional vehicle owned by the same licensee: twenty
dollars ($20.00).
         Each taxicab license shall be renewed by July 1 of each year. All
applications shall be submitted thirty days prior to renewal in order to allow
sufficient time to process each application.
   (f)   Transfers. (EDITOR'S NOTE: Subsection (f) was repealed by Ordinance
98-32, passed July 6, 1998.)
   (g)   Safety Inspections. Every applicant for the issuance or renewal of a
taxicab license shall have the taxicab to be licensed inspected for conformity
with the safety regulations issued by the License Officer. Each taxicab shall
also be inspected by the City for compliance prior to the issuance of a decal
by the City and the operator shall provide to the License Officer a fully
completed Illinois Safety Lane Inspection. The operator of every taxicab shall
be solely financially responsible for the expense of each safety inspection or
reinspection.
   (h)   Lettering on Vehicle. Each taxicab, while operated, shall have printed
on each side of the vehicle the name of the taxi company in letters readable
from a distance of twenty feet, if more than one vehicle in the fleet, a
vehicle number that distinguishes it from the rest of the fleet in letters
readable from a distance of twenty feet.
   (i)   Unlawful Discrimination. In conducting all taxicab business licensed
under this chapter, no licensee shall commit any action which shall be
constitute “unlawful discrimination” as such term is defined below. “Unlawful
discrimination” shall mean any discrimination against a person because of his
or her race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, marital
status, order of protection status, disability, military status, sexual
orientation, pregnancy, unfavorable discharge from military service,
citizenship status, sexual harassment, language or arrest record, as those
terms are defined in the Illinois Human Rights Act, codified at 775 ILCS 5/1-
101, et seq., as amended. The taxicab service licensee hereunder qualifies as a
“Place of Public Accommodation” under Article II of the Illinois Human Rights
Act [See 775 ILCS 5/5-101(A)(11)] and the licensee hereunder is an “operator”
under the same statute [See 775 ILCS 5/5-101(B)].
   All licensees hereunder shall strictly comply with each and every duty of an
“employer” as imposed by Article II of the Illinois Human Rights Act, as
amended, and of a “place of public accommodation” (and as an “operator”
thereof) as required by Article V of the Illinois Human Rights Act, as amended.
   (j)   The licensee shall not permanently change the hours of his licensed
taxicabs without the prior written approval of the License Officer appointed
pursuant to this chapter. The licensee shall give written notice of any
temporary change in hours of operation of his/her/its licensed taxicabs,
including the expected length of said change(s), to the license officer within
two business days after implementing said temporary change(s).
(1977 Code § 9-1802; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89; Ord. 91-43. Passed 8-5-91;
Ord. 91-44. Passed 8-19-91; Ord. 98-32. Passed 7-6-98; Ord. 2013-35. Passed 8-
5-13; Ord. 2016-11. Passed 2-16-16.)
868.03 DRIVERS' LICENSES.
   (a)   License Required. No person shall drive a taxicab, or be hired or
permitted to do so, on the streets of the City, and no person who owns or
controls a taxicab shall permit it to be so driven, and no taxicab licensed by
the City shall be so driven at any time for hire, unless the driver of such
taxicab shall have first obtained a valid and current taxi driver's license
issued in his or her name from the City.
   (b)   License Qualifications. Every applicant for a taxi driver's license
shall:
      (1)   Meet each and every qualification provided in
Chapter 802;
      (2)   Be at least eighteen years of age and have issued in his or her
name a current and valid driver's license from the officer of the Secretary of
State;
      (3)   Have good eyesight and hearing, be in generally good health and be
physically fit to drive a taxicab;
      (4)   Not be addicted to intoxicating liquors or to narcotics;
      (5)   Be of good moral character;
      (6)   Not have been convicted of a violation of any ordinance or
regulation of the City or any Federal or State statute, regulation or other
form of law, the violation of which reflects unfavorably upon his or her
fitness to drive a taxicab;
      (7)   Be competent to operate a motor vehicle;
      (8)   Be familiar with the traffic laws and ordinances;
      (9)   Successfully pass an examination to be administered by the License
Officer as to his or her knowledge of the City; and
      (10)   Submit to and successfully pass a drug test administered by an
approved health facility, at the sole expense of the applicant or his or her
employer.
   (c)   Application. Every applicant for a taxi driver’s license shall, in
addition to supplying the information required by the terms of this chapter and
Chapter 802 , at the time of the filing of the one copy of the application,
deliver to the office of the City Clerk one color photograph of the applicant
or email to the office of the City Clerk one digital color photograph of the
applicant, taken within thirty days of the date of the filing of the
application. The photograph shall be no less than two inches by two inches
square. The photograph and application shall remain the sole property of the
City and shall not be returned to the applicant. The application shall include,
in addition to that information required by
Chapter 802 , the following information:
      (1)   The names and addresses of four personal references who are
residents of the City, who have each known the applicant for a period of not
less than two years and who will vouch for the sobriety, honesty and general
good character of the applicant;
      (2)   The experience of the applicant in the transportation of
passengers;
      (3)   The educational history of the applicant;
      (4)   A concise history of the applicant's employment history;
      (5)   Copies of the required lease or leases between the driver and the
holder of any and all taxicab licenses; and
      (6)   Any further information as may be reasonably required by the
License Officer.
   (d)   License Fee. If the application is approved, each applicant shall pay
an additional annual fee of twenty dollars ($20.00) prior to the issuance or
reissuance of such license. Each taxi driver’s license shall be renewed by July
1 of each year. All applications shall be submitted thirty days prior to
renewal in order to allow sufficient time to process each application.
(1977 Code § 9-1803(a) to (d); Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89; Ord. 91-45. Passed
8-19-91; Ord. 98-32. Passed 7-6-98; Ord. 2001-48. Passed 11-5-01; Ord. 2013-35.
Passed 8-5-13; Ord. 2016- 11. Passed 2-16-16.)
868.04 LEASE OF TAXICABS.
   (a)   A holder of a taxicab license issued as provided in this chapter may
lease the licensed taxicab to another person upon such terms as they mutually,
expressly agree upon by written contract, subject to the restrictions contained
in this Business Regulation and Taxation Code and the regulations promulgated
hereunder, provided that the driver thereof is duly licensed by the City as a
taxi driver as required by this chapter. A holder of a taxi driver license who
is not also a holder of a taxicab license must enter into a lease with the
owner of a taxicab license in order to operate a taxicab.
   (b)   No holder of a taxicab license shall lease or contract for the
independent operation or management of the licensed taxicab for any
consideration whatsoever without the prior written approval of the License
Officer. Each such lease or contract shall be in writing and in a form approved
by the License Officer, provided that where the relationship is one of
employer-employee, no such writing shall be required. The holder of the taxicab
license shall provide an accurate copy of any such executed lease to the
License Officer prior to permitting the taxi driver to drive the licensed
taxicab. The License Officer shall issue regulations governing the following
terms of such leases and contracts:
      (1)   The identification of the parties;
      (2)   The identification of the leased vehicle;
      (3)   The duration of the lease; and
      (4)   Obligations of the lessor for maintaining the safety of the
vehicle.
   In formulating such regulations, the License Officer shall consider the
effect of the lease or contract on the safety of the public, the maintenance
and care of taxicabs and the availability of taxicabs. The lessor shall not
lease any taxicab to any qualified driver unless that taxicab is fit for
service as a taxicab.
   (c)   No person, other than the lessor, the contractor or an employee of the
holder of the taxicab license, shall operate the taxicab during the term of the
lease or contract. There shall be no discrimination against any person employed
or seeking employment on account of race, color, religion, national origin,
gender or ancestry.
(1977 Code § 9-1803(e); Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89.)
868.05 TAXI DISPATCHING SERVICE LICENSES. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: Section 868.05 was repealed by Ordinance 2016-11, passed
February 16, 2016.)
868.06 GENERAL LICENSING REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)   Materials Submitted to Remain Property of the City. All materials
submitted by an applicant for a taxicab license or for a taxi driver’s license,
including, but not limited to, all copies of the application and any of their
supporting documentation, shall remain the sole and exclusive property of the
City and shall not be returned to the applicant without a valid court order
therefore.
   (b)   Duration. The duration of every taxicab license and taxi driver’s
license shall be from July 1 of each year to June 30 of the next year.
   (c)   Referral of Applications to Chief of Police.
      (1)   The applicant shall file one copy of every application for a
taxicab license or a taxi driver’s license. They shall be referred by the
License Officer to the Chief of Police for investigation of the applicant and/
or the vehicle to be licensed. The applicant shall submit himself or herself
and/or the vehicle to be licensed to such examinations and shall furnish such
information and documents as the Chief may reasonably require. The applicant
shall also submit to fingerprinting by the Police Department for the purpose of
conducting a criminal history investigation of the applicant. The fingerprints
submitted by the applicant shall remain the sole and exclusive property of the
City.
      (2)   The Chief shall state, in writing, upon every application for a
taxicab license or for a taxi driver’s license his or her recommendation as to
whether the license should be issued. If the Chief shall recommend that the
license should not be issued, he or she shall state his or her reasons
therefore on the face of the application. The Chief shall forward one copy of
the application to the License Officer and shall retain the second copy for the
files of the Police Department.
   (d)   Review of Recommendation of Chief of Police; Appeals to Review
Committee. If the License Officer disagrees with the recommendation of the
Chief of Police, or if both the License Officer and the Chief recommend that
the taxicab or taxi driver's license not be issued, the Licensing Officer shall
not issue the license. The person denied the license shall have thirty days in
which to file a written notice of appeal of the denial of such license with the
City Manager’s office. The City Manager shall then hold a hearing to determine
whether such license should be issued. The applicant shall be given written
notice of the date and time of this review hearing at least five days prior to
the hearing, as well as the reason why the License Officer and/or the Chief
recommends that the license should not be issued. The City shall not be
required to present any evidence at this hearing, other than the written
recommendations of the License Officer and/or the Chief. The rules of evidence
applicable to the courts of this State shall not apply to this hearing, and the
City Manager shall receive evidence liberally in order to be fully informed on
the issues. The City Manager shall decide whether to issue the license and
shall issue its decision in writing. The applicant may seek judicial review of
a denial of a license in accordance with the provisions of the Illinois
Administrative Review Act, as now or hereafter amended.
(1977 Code § 9-1805; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89; Ord. 90-21. Passed 3-5-90;
Ord. 98-32. Passed 7-6-98; Ord. 2011-51. Passed 10-3-11; Ord. 2013-35. Passed
8-5-13; Ord. 2016-11. Passed 2-16-16; Ord. 2017-56. Passed 7-17-17.)
868.07 PENDING SUITS; RIGHTS ACCRUED.
   Nothing herein adopted shall be construed to affect any suit now pending in
any court, any rights accrued or liability incurred or any cause or causes of
action accrued or existing under any prior resolution or ordinance, nor shall
any right or remedy of any character be lost, impaired or affected by this
chapter.
(1977 Code § 9-1806; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89.)
868.08 CONTINUANCE AND RENEWAL OF LICENSES NOT GUARANTEED; CONSENT OF LICENSE
OFFICER REQUIRED FOR TRANSFERS, SALES, ETC., OF LICENSES.
   Nothing herein is intended to grant to any taxicab licensee or any taxi
driver licensee a right to a license, or to its continuance or renewal.
Licenses are merely a personal privilege issued only in the name of the owner
of the business and shall not be assigned, transferred, sold, pledged,
encumbered or hypothecated without the consent of the License Officer, either
voluntarily or involuntarily, to another person or persons, nor shall it be
subject to attachment, garnishment or execution. A license shall only be issued
to one individual or corporation, except in the case of a bona fide
partnership, as demonstrated by proof satisfactory to the License Officer.
(1977 Code §9-1807; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89; Ord. 2016-11. Passed 2-16-16.)
868.09 RECORD OF LICENSES.
   The City Clerk shall prepare all taxicab licenses and all taxi driver's
licenses issued by the License Officer and shall keep a current index thereof.
Each taxicab and taxi driver's license shall be numbered from one. The City
Clerk shall number each taxicab and taxi driver's license in consecutive order,
as determined by the date and time of issuance.
(1977 Code § 9-1808; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89.)
868.10 GENERAL APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)   Applications for a license shall be made, signed and sworn to by a
duly authorized agent of the corporation or partnership. In addition to the
information specified elsewhere in this chapter, the application shall state
all of the names, addresses and local telephone numbers of the general and
limited partners of the partnership and of the officers and directors of the
corporation.
   (b)   Each corporate applicant for a taxicab license shall be organized and
qualified to do business under the laws of the State. Each general or limited
partner of a partnership applicant for a taxicab license shall meet the
qualifications as if he or she were an individual applicant.
   (c)   Each applicant for a taxicab license shall have its local place of
business inside the corporate limits or within thirty-five miles of the
corporate limits of the City.
   (d)   All corporate applicants for a license shall file with the office of
the City Clerk current copies of their Articles of Incorporation at the time of
filing their applications for initial licenses from the City. Partnerships
shall likewise file current copies of their Articles or Agreement of
Partnership when filling for their initial licenses. Annually thereafter, each
corporate or partnership applicant shall annually file a statement that no
material changes have occurred in such documents and shall file a corrected
current copy of said documents. Corporate applicant shall annually file a
certificate of corporate good standing issued by the Secretary of State of the
State of Illinois.
   (e)   In determining whether to issue a taxicab license, the License Officer
shall consider the character and reputation of the corporate or partnership
applicant, its general and limited partners and its officers and directors as
law abiding citizens, including, but not limited to, the disciplinary record of
the applicant in the operation of its licensed taxicabs either in the City or
elsewhere, as well as the disciplinary record of the applicant, or of any of
the general or limited partners of the partnership or of the officers and
directors of the corporation, as licensed taxi drivers, either in the City of
elsewhere.
(1977 Code §9-1809; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89; Ord. 2008-07. Passed 1-22-08;
Ord. 2011- 51. Passed 10-3-11; Ord. 2016-11. Passed 2-16-16.)
868.11 PREVIOUS REVOCATIONS.
   No applicant shall be eligible for a license if any City taxicab license,
taxi driver's license or taxi dispatching service license, respectively, he or
she has held within the previous five years was revoked.
(1977 Code § 9-1810; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89.)
868.12 CRIMINAL CONVICTIONS.
   (a)   Taxicab License.
      (1)   If an applicant, any general or limited partner of a partnership
applicant for a taxicab license, a corporate applicant for such license or any
of its officers or directors, has been convicted of a felony based upon his,
her or its conduct or involvement in such taxi business activity or similar
business [as the term “felony” is defined by 720 ILCS 5/2-7, as amended, or any
similar offense under the laws of any other state, the Federal Government or
any other nation], within the ten year period immediately preceding the date of
filing of said application, then such applicant shall not be eligible for the
issuance or re-issuance of a taxicab license.
      (2)   Additionally, such an applicant shall not be eligible for a taxicab
license if the applicant(s) has been convicted of a felony or misdemeanor
unrelated to his or her conduct or involvement in taxicab business activity or
similar business activity, which felony or misdemeanor involves any of the
following criminal offenses within the time period immediately preceding the
filing of the application for taxicab license as listed below:
         A.   Unlawful possession with the intent to deliver: any controlled
substance, as such term is defined in the Illinois Controlled Substances Act
(720 ILCS 570/100 et seq.), as amended from time to time; or cannabis, as
defined in the Cannabis Control Act (720 ILCS 550/1 et seq.), as amended from
time to time; or an intoxicating compound, as listed or defined in the
Intoxicating Compounds Act (720 ILCS 690/0.01 et seq.), as amended from time to
time, within the past ten years;
         B.   Unlawful possession of any controlled substance, cannabis or
intoxicating compound, within the past five years;
         C.   Criminal sexual assault and criminal sexual abuse, as such
offenses are defined in the Illinois Criminal Code 720 ILCS 5/1-1 et seq., or
any like offense of another state or country, within the past ten years;
         D.   Any offense as described in the definition of “Forcible Felony”
in Section 2-8 of the Illinois Criminal Code of 2012 [codified as 720 ILCS 5/2-
8], as amended, or any other offense involving violence against another person
or threatened violence against another person under the Illinois Criminal Code
720 ILCS 5/1-1 et seq., or any like offense of another state or country, within
the past ten years; or
         E.   Any offense involving moral turpitude, including, but not limited
to any offense involving the misapplication, misappropriation or misuse of
funds of another person, within the past five years.
      (3)   An applicant(s) shall not be eligible for the issuance or re-
issuance of a taxicab license if he/she/it has been convicted of a misdemeanor
based upon his/her/its conduct or involvement in taxicab business activity or
similar business activity within the past five years.
   (b)   Taxi Driver's License. Any person who has been convicted of any
forcible felony criminal offense as defined by the laws of the State of
Illinois or any similar offense under the laws of any other state, the Federal
government or any other nation, shall not be eligible for a taxi driver's
license from the City and shall not drive a taxicab within the City.
Additionally, any applicant for a taxi driver's license shall not be eligible
for the issuance or renewal of said taxi driver's license if said person has
been convicted of any of the following criminal offenses under the laws of the
State of Illinois, or any similar offense under the laws of any other state,
the Federal government or any other nation:
      (1)   Unlawful possession with the intent to deliver: any controlled
substance, as such term is defined in the Illinois Controlled Substances Act
(720 ILCS 570/100 et seq.), as amended from time to time; or cannabis, as
defined in the Cannabis Control Act (720 ILCS 550/1 et seq.), as amended from
time to time; or an intoxicating compound, as listed or defined in the
Intoxicating Compounds Act (720 ILCS 690/0.01 et seq.), as amended from time to
time, within the ten year period immediately preceding the filing of said
application;
      (2)   Unlawful possession of any controlled substance, cannabis or
intoxicating compound within the ten year period immediately preceding the
filing of said application;
      (3)   The offenses of criminal sexual assault and criminal sexual abuse,
as such offenses are defined in the Illinois Criminal Code (720 ILCS 5/1-1 et
seq.), within the ten year period immediately preceding the filing of said
application;
      (4)   Any offense involving violence against another person or threatened
violence against another person under the Illinois Criminal Code (720 ILCS 5/1-
1 et seq.), within the ten year period immediately preceding the filing of said
application;
      (5)   Any offense involving moral turpitude, including, but not limited
to any offense involving the misapplication, misappropriation or misuse of
funds of another person within the five year period immediately preceding the
filing of said application;
      (6)   The offense of driving under the influence of a controlled
substance, cannabis or an intoxicating compound under Illinois law (625 ILCS 5/
11-501 et seq.), as amended from time to time within the five year period
immediately preceding the filing of said application;
      (7)   A second or subsequent conviction of the offense of driving under
the influence of a controlled substance, cannabis or an intoxicating compound
under Illinois law (625 ILCS 5/11-501 et seq.), as amended from time to time
within the ten year period immediately preceding the filing of said
application;
      (8)   The offense of reckless driving under Illinois law (625 ILCS 5/11-
503 et seq.), as amended from time to time within the five year period
immediately preceding the filing of said application;
      (9)   The offense of aggravated fleeing to elude or attempted aggravated
fleeing to elude under Illinois law (625 ILCS 5/11-204.1 et seq.), as amended
from time to time within the five year period immediately preceding the filing
of said application;
      (10)   The offense of fleeing to elude or attempted fleeing to elude
under Illinois law (625 ILCS 5/11-204 et seq.), as amended from time to time
within the five year period immediately preceding the filing of said
application; and
      (11)   The offense of leaving the scene of a motor vehicle accident
involving death or personal injuries under Illinois law (625 ILCS 5/11-401 et
seq.), as amended from time to time within the five year period immediately
preceding the filing of said application.
   (c)   Ineligibility for Taxi Driver's License Based on Criminal Convictions
or on Registration Status. An applicant shall not be eligible for a taxi
driver's license if said applicant, was ever registered in the:
      (1)   Illinois Sex Offender database or similar database in another state
or country; or
      (2)   Illinois Murderer and Violent Offender Against Youth database or a
similar database in another state or country.
   (d)   Rehabilitation of Applicants. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary
stated above, an applicant with an otherwise disqualifying criminal conviction
or registration status shall be eligible for a taxicab license and/or a taxi
driver's license if the City's License Officer first determines that such
person has been sufficiently rehabilitated to warrant the public trust after
considering matters set forth in such person's application and the Police
Chiefs investigation.
   The Compliance Officer shall not declare as rehabilitated and eligible for a
taxicab license and/or a taxi driver's license any applicant as defined above
who has at any time a prior criminal felony conviction for any sexual crime in
this State of Illinois or in any other state or nation. Additionally, the
Compliance Officer shall not declare as rehabilitated and eligible for a
taxicab license and/or a taxi driver's license any applicant as defined above
who has at any time a prior criminal felony conviction for any controlled
substance or marijuana criminal offense other than for mere possession without
any intent to deliver in this State of Illinois or in any other state or
nation.
   (e)   Restriction on Employment. No taxicab licensee shall knowingly employ
or continue the employment of any person as a taxi driver who is not eligible
for a taxi driver's license for any reason, including but not limited to being
convicted for any of the disqualifying criminal convictions listed above or for
being required to register on either of the databases listed in subsection (c)
above.
   (f)   When this section refers to a period of years for a criminal
conviction which disqualifies an applicant from being issued or holding a
taxicab license or a taxi driver license under this chapter, said period of
years shall begin on the later of (1) the date of conviction for said criminal
offense and (2) the date of the applicant's release from penal incarceration
based upon said conviction.
(Ord. 98-32. Passed 7-6-98; Ord. 2016-11. Passed 2-16-16.)
868.13 CHANGES IN ADDRESS.
   It is the duty of every person issued any type of license provided for in
this chapter to notify the License Officer, in writing, of any change in his or
her address or telephone number. Any notice required or permitted to be given
to a licensee hereunder shall be sufficient if addressed to the last City
address recorded in the office of the City Clerk.
(1977 Code § 9-1812; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89.)
868.14 DISPLAY OF LICENSES.
   Every operator or driver of a taxicab shall, while the taxicab is being
operated, prominently display, so that they are clearly visible to every
passenger in the taxicab, the following:
   (a)   A current and valid taxi driver's license issued in the name of the
driver of the taxicab by the City;
   (b)   A current and valid taxicab license issued for that taxicab by the
City; and
   (c)   A current and valid decal affixed to the rear window of the taxicab by
an authorized agent of the City.
(Ord. 98-32. Passed 7-6-98.)
868.15 PROMULGATION OF REGULATIONS BY LICENSE OFFICER.
   The License Officer is hereby empowered to promulgate any and all
regulations in furtherance of the provisions of this chapter, provided that
such regulations shall not be inconsistent with the terms of this chapter. All
regulations promulgated by the License Officer shall first be submitted to and
approved by the City Council.
(1977 Code § 9-1814; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89; Ord. 2011-51. Passed 10-3-
11.)
868.16 INSURANCE.
   (a)   Every operator of a taxicab shall maintain in full force and effect,
for the complete term of the taxicab license, public liability and property
damage insurance and, where applicable, workers' compensation insurance for his
or her employees, with solvent and responsible insurers approved, in writing,
by the License Officer, licensed by and authorized to do business in the State,
and qualified under the laws of the State to assume the risks in the amounts
hereinafter set forth to secure payment by the holder of the taxicab license or
his or her agents, employees or lessees of any final judgment or settlement of
any claim against them resulting from any occurrence caused by or arising out
of the operation or use of any of the taxicabs of the holder of the taxicab
license. Every insurance policy or contract for such insurance shall provide
that suit may be brought in any court of competent jurisdiction upon such
policy or contract by any person for the payment or satisfaction of any final
judgment rendered against the holder of the taxicab license or the person
insured arising from the operation or use of such vehicle. Every public
liability insurance policy shall meet the requirements of State law, including,
but not limited to, 215 ILCS 5/143a and 5/143a-2, as amended, governing
coverage from owners or operators of uninsured motor vehicles, hit-and-run
motor vehicles and underinsured motorists. Such public liability insurance
policies must also be acceptable to the City Legal Counsel of the City, as to
form and legality. Each public liability insurance policy shall provide the
following coverage:
      (1)   For damage to property and to person for a single incident,
combined limit:   $300,000
      (2)   For uninsured motorist coverage:
         Per person:   20,000
         Per accident:   40,000
   (b)   The public liability insurance policy shall contain a description of
each taxicab insured, the manufacturer's name and number, the State license
number and the taxicab vehicle license number.
   (c)   No taxicab license shall be issued, nor shall any taxicab license be
transferred, until the applicant has deposited with the office of the City
Clerk copies of the insurance policies which are certified by the insurers. The
certified copies of such insurance policies obtained and posted by the
applicant shall provide that the insurer will give to the City notice, in
writing, at least thirty days prior to any cancellation of such insurance
policies.
   (d)   If any insurance policy is cancelled or permitted to lapse for any
reason, the License Officer shall suspend the taxicab license for the vehicle
affected for a period not to exceed ten days to permit another insurance policy
to be supplied in accordance with the provisions of this section. If such other
insurance policy is not posted with the License Officer within the period of
the suspension of the taxicab license, the License Officer shall revoke the
taxicab license for such vehicle. In the event that such insurance is supplied,
the License Officer shall nevertheless suspend the taxicab license for each
vehicle affected for an additional period of five days for every day of
noncompliance, except by reason of the insolvency of the insurer without
advance written notice to the holder of the taxicab license, for the first such
violation of insurance requirements, and a period of ten days for every day of
noncompliance for the second such violation within any three-year period. The
third violation of this insurance requirement within any three-year period
shall result in the revocation of the taxicab license of the affected vehicle.
   (e)   No person shall drive or operate a taxicab unless he or she is covered
by a valid and current insurance policy as described in subsection (a) hereof.
(1977 Code §9-1815; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89; Ord. 90-21. Passed 3-5-90;
Ord. 2017-56. Passed 7-17-17.)
868.17 CONDUCT OF DRIVERS.
   No licensed taxi driver or licensed taxicab owner, while operating a
taxicab, shall:
   (a)   Violate any of the provisions of this chapter or Chapter 802 of these
Codified Ordinances.
   (b)   Violate any of the regulations promulgated hereunder by the License
Officer;
   (c)   Violate any provision of these Codified Ordinances or any other City
ordinance, regulation or resolution;
   (d)   Fail to obey the lawful order of the License Officer or any sworn
member of the City's Police Department;
   (e)   Consume any intoxicating or alcoholic liquor;
   (f)   Use any profane, abusive or obscene language;
   (g)   Intentionally reduce or increase the fare due from a passenger from
the amount owed according to the rate schedule on file with the office of the
City Clerk;
   (h)   Fail to report to the License Officer within twenty-four hours any
violations of this Business Regulation and Taxation Code, any Federal or State
statute, regulation or other form of law, that he or she observes, whether
committed by a member of the public or by another taxi driver;
   (i)   Knowingly permit any taxicab to be used in the perpetration of any
criminal offense or ordinance violation;
   (j)   Refuse to accept as a passenger any person who seeks to so use the
taxicab, provided that such person is not intoxicated and conducts himself or
herself in an orderly manner;
   (k)   Allow any person to ride in the front seat of the taxicab with the
driver, except at such times as when the rear seat is fully occupied by paying
passengers, when the front seat is occupied by an elderly or disabled passenger
or when the front seat is occupied by a driver trainee.
   (l)   Stand, park or stop in any residential district, except for the
purpose of receiving or discharging passengers or at the direction of a police
officer (the parking of a licensed taxicab in a legal off-street parking space
at the driver’s residence shall not constitute a violation of this subsection);
   (m)   Be discourteous to any passenger or physically or verbally abuse any
passenger;
   (n)   Fail to permit the License Officer or his or her designee access to
inspect the documents kept by the licensee during reasonable and ordinary
business hours;
   (o)   Solicit business for any hotel, or attempt to divert patronage from
one hotel to another (the solicitation of a hotel to purchase advertisement for
said hotel on or within the taxicab or the display of an advertisement for any
one or more hotels within or on the taxicab shall not constitute a violation of
this subsection);
   (p)   Engage in selling, consuming or possessing intoxicating or alcoholic
liquors or any narcotics or other illegal drugs;
   (q)   Solicit business for any house of prostitution or of unlicensed or
illegal gambling or for any place engaged in the unlicensed sale or delivery of
alcoholic or intoxicating liquors;
   (r)   Shout or call to prospective passengers, or unduly honk the taxicab’s
horn in such a manner so as to disturb the peace;
   (s)   Be unkempt or dirty in appearance;
   (t)   Fail to maintain the licensed taxicab in a safe or clean condition;
   (u)   Permit an unqualified, unauthorized or unlicensed person to drive the
taxicab;
   (v)   Use the licensed taxicab for any purpose other than the transporting
of passengers; or
   (w)   Violate the Drug Free Work Place Act of 1988, the Omnibus
Transportation Act of 1991, all rules and regulations of the Department of
Transportation and other applicable State and Federal laws and regulations
pertaining to standards of conduct with regard to alcohol, and controlled
substances and their effects in the workplace, as set forth in the Freeport
Taxi Substance Abuse Policy. (Ord. 98-32. Passed 7-6-98.)
   (x)   Use a cellular phone while driving, unless a hands-free device is
utilized. (Ord. 2011-51. Passed 10-3-11.)
(Ord. 2016-11. Passed 2-16-16; Ord. 2024-15. Passed 4-1-24.)
868.18 RESPONSIBILITIES OF TAXI DISPATCHING SERVICES. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: Section 868.18 was repealed by Ordinance 2016-11, passed
February 16, 2016.)
868.19 SUSPENSION OF LICENSE FOR LOSS OF DISPATCHING SERVICES. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: Section 868.19 was repealed by Ordinance 2016-11, passed
February 16, 2016.)
868.20 LOSS OF DRIVER'S LICENSE.
   If any taxi driver licensed as provided in this chapter shall have his or
her State driver's license suspended by the office of the Secretary of State,
the License Officer shall suspend the taxi driver's license until such time as
the taxi driver shall present sufficient proof to the License Officer of the
re-issuance of a valid State driver's license. If the taxi driver's State
driver's license is either cancelled or revoked, then the License Officer shall
revoke the taxi driver license issued under this chapter.
(1977 Code § 9-1819; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89.)
868.21 RESPONSIBILITY OF LICENSEE FOR VIOLATIONS.
   For the purposes of this chapter, every taxicab licensee or taxi driver
licensee shall be deemed responsible for the unlawful acts of his or her agents
or employees, whether or not such licensee knowingly permits or has actual
knowledge of such unlawful acts.
(1977 Code § 9-1820; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89.)
868.22 ENFORCEMENT BY POLICE DEPARTMENT; VIOLATIONS.
   The Police Department shall monitor the operation of the taxicabs and the
conduct of taxi drivers. Violations of this chapter shall be reported to the
License Officer.
(1977 Code § 9-1821; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89.)
868.23 INSPECTIONS.
   The License Officer or the Chief of Police may order the operator of a
taxicab to have the taxicab inspected by authorized agents of the City to
ensure that the taxicab is in a mechanically safe condition and in strict
compliance with the City's regulations. No operator or driver may operate a
taxicab that has been ordered inspected until the taxicab successfully
completes the safety inspection. Such order may be issued at any time, and the
operator of the taxicab shall be solely financially responsible for any and all
costs of such inspection.
   The Police Chief, or his or her designee, shall inspect each taxicab at
least once annually or more often as the Police Chief or the License Officer
shall deem necessary because of safety concerns as to said taxicab or the
licensed taxi drivers thereof. This inspection(s) by the Police Chief or his/
her designee shall be in addition to any safety inspection as is mandated by
Section 868.02(g).
(1977 Code §9-1823; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89; Ord. 2016-11. Passed 2-16-16.)
868.24 FARE SCHEDULE.
   The fare and rate schedule to be charged customers shall be kept on file
with the office of the City Clerk at all times, and no change in such schedule
shall be made without first filing the changed schedule with the office of the
City Clerk no less than thirty days prior to the effective date thereof. No
extra charge shall be made for baggage or parcels the size of which permits
them to be carried in the passenger compartment of the taxicab.
(1977 Code § 9-1824; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89.)
868.25 DISPLAY OF STATEMENT OF FARE.
   The operator and driver of every taxicab shall ensure that every taxicab,
while it is being operated, prominently displays a schedule of the rates
charged identical to the schedule on file with the office of the City Clerk so
that such is clearly visible to any passenger in the rear seat of the taxicab.
(1977 Code § 9-1825; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89.)
868.26 CHANGES IN DISPATCHING SERVICES. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: Section 868.25 was repealed by Ordinance 2016-11, passed
February 16, 2016.)
868.27 PAYMENT OF JUDGMENTS OR AWARDS FOR DAMAGES.
   Every licensed taxi driver and every holder of a taxicab license shall pay
each judgment or award for loss or damage arising from the operation or use of
a licensed taxicab rendered against such licensee by any court or commission of
competent jurisdiction within ninety days after its judgment or award shall
have become final and not stayed by order of court. If any such judgment shall
not be so paid, the License Officer shall revoke the taxicab license or the
taxi driver license affected.
(1977 Code § 9-1827; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89.)
868.28 DISCONTINUATION OF SERVICE.
   If the operation of the licensed taxicab is discontinued for ten consecutive
days for any reason, except on account of a lawful strike, act of God,
shortages of gasoline or other necessary materials or cause beyond the control
of the holder of the taxicab license, other than the inability of the holder of
the taxicab license to lease his or her taxicab, the holder of the taxicab
license shall notify the License Officer, in writing, that such taxicab is out
of service. The License Officer may give written notice to the holder of the
taxicab license to restore the taxicab to service, and if it is not restored
within five days after receipt of the notice, the License Officer may in his or
her discretion, revoke such taxicab license. The notice shall be deemed
received on the third day after being placed in a United States mail
receptacle, bearing proper postage thereon.
(1977 Code § 9-1828; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89.)
868.29 RESERVATION OF AUTHORITY.
   Nothing in this chapter shall be construed so as to limit the City in the
exercise of its police powers. The City hereby expressly reserves the right to
enact all reasonable ordinances and regulations affecting any and all licensees
hereunder which may be necessary to promote or secure the health, safety,
morals, comfort and general welfare of its citizens.
(1977 Code § 9-1829; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89.)
868.30 REISSUANCE OF LICENSES.
   Any license issued under this chapter which has been revoked, surrendered,
cancelled or not applied for within a period of two months after such license
application is due may be reissued by the License Officer to any qualified
person in conformity with the provisions of this chapter.
868.31 SUSPENSION AND REVOCATION OF LICENSES.
   A violation of any provision of this chapter is grounds for the denial,
suspension or revocation of any license granted under this chapter. The
determination and enforcement of the appropriate penalty is the responsibility
of the License Officer, and in assessing such penalty, he or she shall be
guided by the nature, seriousness and number of offenses. In all other cases of
denial, suspension or revocation, the Review Committee established in Section
868.06 is empowered to hear appeals. Upon written request by a licensee whose
license has been suspended or revoked, the Review Committee shall convene
within five days to hear testimony. The City shall not be required to present
any evidence at this hearing, other than the written recommendation of the
License Officer. The rules of evidence applicable to the courts of this State
shall not apply to this hearing, and the Review Committee shall receive
evidence liberally in order to be fully informed on the issues. The Review
Committee shall decide by majority vote whether to uphold the decision of the
License Officer and shall issue its judicial review in accordance with the
provisions of the Illinois Administrative Review Act, as now or hereafter
amended.
(1977 Code § 9-1832; Ord. 89-67. Passed 11-20-89; Ord. 2016-11. Passed 2-16-
16.)
868.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
202.99 for general Code penalty if no specific penalty is provided.)
CHAPTER 869
Teen Dance Centers
