1420.01 INTERNATIONAL BUILDING CODE "IBC".
   For the purpose of prescribing construction and material specifications for
buildings, structures and improvements in the City, that certain document
marked and designated as the 2018 International Building Code “IBC”, as
promulgated by the International Code Council, is hereby adopted as the
Building Code of the City, save and except for such portions thereof as may be
amended or repealed in this chapter. Whenever referenced herein, the
"International Building Code" or "IBC" shall refer to the version thereof
adopted by the City, including any amendments thereto adopted by the City.
(Ord. 96-03. Passed 1-16-96; Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04; Ord. 2011-20. Passed
5-2-11; Ord. 2013-40. Passed 9-3-13; Ord. 2024-37. Passed 8-5-24.)
1420.02 APPLICATION OF CODE.
   The International Building Code, as adopted in Section
1420.01, shall be applicable to all buildings, structures and improvements in
the City, with the exception of structures utilizing Intermodal Shipping
Containers as structural or design elements per Section
1420.08, or those buildings, structures and improvements covered by
Chapter 1482 of these Codified Ordinances.
(Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04; Ord. 2005-19. Passed 6-6-05; Ord. 2024-07. Passed
2-5-24.)
1420.03 FILE COPIES.
   At least one copy of the International Building Code “IBC”, as adopted in
Section
1420.01, and the 2021 IBC, or at minimum the provisions thereof adopted in
Section
1420.08 shall be kept on file in the office of the Building Commissioner, and
there kept available for public use, inspection and examination.
(Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04; Ord. 2011-20. Passed 5-2-11; Ord. 2013-10. Passed
3-4-13; Ord. 2024-07. Passed 2-5-24.)
1420.04   CONFLICT OF LAWS.
   (a)   In the event of a conflict between any of the provisions of the
International Building Code "IBC", as adopted in Section
1420.01, and any provision of these Codified Ordinances, or any other local
ordinance or resolution, the local provision shall control.
   (b)   In the event of a conflict between any of the provisions of such Code
and a provision of any other technical code adopted or referred to by the City
as a standard, the higher or stricter standard shall control.
(Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04; Ord. 2011-20. Passed 5-2-11.)
1420.05   VIOLATIONS; ABATEMENT; SEPARATE OFFENSES.
   (a)   No person shall erect, construct, occupy or maintain any building or
other structure in violation of any of the provisions of the International
Building Code “IBC”, as adopted in Section
1420.01, or cause, permit or suffer any such violation to be committed.
   (b)   It is the responsibility of the offender to abate the violation as
expeditiously as possible, and each day during which such violation is
permitted to continue shall constitute a separate offense.
(Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04; Ord. 2013-40. Passed 9-3-13; Ord. 2024-37. Passed
8-5-24.)
1420.06   FEES.
   Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the 2012 International Building
Code "IBC", as adopted in Section
1420.01, fees to be charged for inspections and issuance of building permits
shall be as specified in
Chapter 1442 of these Codified Ordinances.
(Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04; Ord. 2013-40. Passed 9-3-13.)
1420.07   AUTOMATIC SPRINKLER SYSTEMS.
   Automatic sprinkler systems shall be installed and operational, as specified
in the International Building Code “IBC” in all buildings and structures which
have a total area in excess of the applicable square footage listed in Chapter
9 of said Code, with the exception of Section 903.3.1.3 thereof entitled “NFPA
13D sprinkler systems”.
(Ord. 96-23. Passed 6-17-96; Ord. 2003-75. Passed 11-3-03; Ord. 2004-32. Passed
6-7-04; Ord. 2013-40. Passed 9-3-13; Ord. 2024-37. Passed 8-5-24.)
1420.08 INTERMODAL SHIPPING CONTAINERS.
   Any structure which utilizes an intermodal shipping container as a
structural or design element shall comply with Section 3115 of the 2021
International Building Code (the "2021 IBC"). Any Code, Chapter, Section, ASCE,
Diagram, or Table references in said Section 3115 of the 2021 IBC shall be
deemed to refer to the 2021 IBC or other applicable Code as referenced, and not
to the 2012 IBC or other Code adopted for structures not utilizing Intermodal
Shipping Containers.
(Ord. 2024-07. Passed 2-5-24.)
1420.09 AMENDMENTS.
   The International Building Code, as adopted in Section
1420.01, is hereby amended as follows:
   Subsection R-104.9.2 is added, as follows:
R-104.9.2 Prefabricated construction assemblies. Prefabricated construction
assemblies, including intermodal shipping containers, must be approved by the
Building Official prior to the time the building permit is issued.
   Subsection 105.1.2 is deleted in its entirety and replaced with the
following:
150.1.2 Ice barriers. All roofs of permanently heated structures shall have an
ice barrier that consists of a self-adhering polymer modified bitumen sheet or
equivalent, in lieu of normal underlayment and extend from the eaves edge to a
point at least twenty-four inches (24") inside the exterior wall line of the
building and a minimum of twenty-four inches (24") on each side of any valley.
   Section 105.2 is hereby DELETED in its entirety and REPLACED as follows:
105.2 Work exempt from permit.
Exemptions from permit requirements of this code shall not be deemed to grant
authorization for any work to be done in any manner in violation of the
provisions of this code or any other laws or ordinances of this jurisdiction.
Permits shall not be required for the following:
Building:
1.   One-story detached accessory structures used as tool and storage sheds,
playhouses and similar uses, provided the floor area is not greater than 120
square feet (11 m2).
2.   Fences not over 7 feet (2134 mm) high.
3.   Oil derricks.
4.   Retaining walls that are not over 4 feet (1219 mm) in height measured from
the bottom of the footing to the top of the wall, unless supporting a surcharge
or impounding Class I, II or IIIA liquids.
5.   Water tanks supported directly on grade if the capacity is not greater
than 5,000 gallons (18 925 L) and the ratio of height to diameter or width is
not greater than 2:1.
6.   Sidewalks and driveways not more than 30 inches (762 mm) above adjacent
grade, and not over any basement or story below and are not part of an
accessible route.
71.   Painting, papering, tiling, carpeting, cabinets, counter tops and similar
finish work.
82.   Temporary motion picture, television and theater stage sets and scenery.
93.   Prefabricated swimming pools accessory to a Group R-3 occupancy that are
less than 24 inches (610 mm) deep, are not greater than 5,000 gallons (18 925
L) and are installed entirely above ground.
104.   Shade cloth structures constructed for nursery or agricultural purposes,
not including service systems.
115.   Swings and other playground equipment accessory to detached one- and
two-family dwellings.
126.   Window awnings in Group R-3 and U occupancies, supported by an exterior
wall that do not project more than 54 inches (1372 mm) from the exterior wall
and do not require additional support.
137.   Nonfixed and movable fixtures, cases, racks, counters and partitions not
over 5 feet 9 inches (1753 mm) in height.
Electrical:
Repairs and maintenance: Minor repair work, including the replacement of lamps
or the connection of approved portable electrical equipment to approved
permanently installed receptacles.
Radio and television transmitting stations: The provisions of this code shall
not apply to electrical equipment used for radio and television transmissions,
but do apply to equipment and wiring for a power supply and the installations
of towers and antennas.
Temporary testing systems: A permit shall not be required for the installation
of any temporary system required for the testing or servicing of electrical
equipment or apparatus.
Gas:
1.   Portable heating appliance.
2.   Replacement of any minor part that does not alter approval of equipment or
make such equipment unsafe.
Mechanical:
1.   Portable heating appliance.
2.   Portable ventilation equipment.
3.   Portable cooling unit.
4.   Steam, hot or chilled water piping within any heating or cooling equipment
regulated by this code.
5.   Replacement of any part that does not alter its approval or make it
unsafe.
6.   Portable evaporative cooler.
7.   Self-contained refrigeration system containing 10 pounds (4.54 kg) or less
of refrigerant and actuated by motors of 1 horsepower (0.75 kW) or less.
Plumbing:
1.   The stopping of leaks in drains, water, soil, waste or vent pipe,
provided, however, that if any concealed trap, drain pipe, water, soil, waste
or vent pipe becomes defective and it becomes necessary to remove and replace
the same with new material, such work shall be considered as new work and a
permit shall be obtained and inspection made as provided in this code.
2.   The clearing of stoppages or the repairing of leaks in pipes, valves or
fixtures and the removal and reinstallation of water closets, provided such
repairs do not involve or require the replacement or rearrangement of valves,
pipes or fixtures.
[A]105.2.1 Emergency repairs.
Where equipment replacements and repairs must be performed in an emergency
situation, the permit application shall be submitted within the next working
business day to the building official.
Subsection 1057.1.2 is deleted in its entirety and replaced with the following:
1507.1.2 Ice barriers. All roofs of permanently heated structures shall have an
ice barrier that consists of a self-adhering polymer modified bitumen sheet or
equivalent, in lieu of normal underlayment and extend from the eaves edge to a
point at least twenty-four inches (24") inside the exterior wall line of the
building and a minimum of twenty-four inches (24") on each side of any
valley.

and deletions as strikethroughs):

stone shall not be less than 16 inches (406 mm) thick. Rubble stone shall not
be used for foundation walls of structures assigned to Seismic Design Category
C, D, E, or F.

and deletions as strikethroughs):

prohbited.shall be designed and installed in accordance with AWC PWF. Lumber

below grade.

and deletions as strikethroughs):
1809.9 Masonry-unit footings.  Masonry-unit footings are not allowed.The

Sections 1809.9.1 and 1809.9.2, and the provisions of Chapter 21.
Exception: Where a specific design is not provided, masonry-unit footings
supporting walls of light-frame construction shall be permitted to be designed

Subsection 2308.5.1.1 is hereby ADDED, as follows:
2308.5.1.1 Bearing walls.  All bearing walls shall be constructed of a minimum
two (2) inch by four (4) inch nominal lumber and shall have a minimum of two
(2), two inch (2") by four inch (4") nominal lumber top plates. Wall stud
spacing shall not exceed sixteen inches (16") on center.
   Exception: Top plates designed in accordance with section 2308.5.3.2.

1422.01 EDITION ADOPTED.
   For the purpose of prescribing regulations governing the installation,
alteration, repair and maintenance of plumbing fixtures, lines and equipment,
that certain document known as the Illinois Plumbing Code 2014, promulgated by
the Department of Public Health, State of Illinois, pursuant to authority
granted by the Illinois Plumbing License Law (225 ILCS 320/0.01 et seq., as
amended), is hereby adopted as the Plumbing Code of the City, save and except
for such portions thereof as may be amended or repealed in this chapter.
(Ord. 96-03. Passed 1-16-96; Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04; Ord. 2011-21. Passed
5-2-11; Ord. 2013-40. Passed 9-3-13; Ord. 2018-52. Passed 11-5-18.)
1422.02 DEFINITIONS.
   In addition to the definitions provided in the Illinois Plumbing Code, as
adopted in Section
1422.01, the following words and terms shall have the definitions given herein.
   (a)   "Blow-off basin" means a watertight receptacle provided to intercept
the blow-off from the boiler and condense the steam before entering a sewer.
   (b)   "Catch basin" means a watertight receptacle built to intercept waste
water which may contain sediment from surface, subsoil, gravel roof or stable
drainage, grease or oils, or from steam or hot water boilers before overflowing
into a sewer or drain.
   (c)   "House sewer" means the sewer which begins three feet outside of the
foundation wall of a building and connects the house or building drain with the
main sewer, or with a septic tank or cesspool on the premises.
   (d)   "Main sewer" means the main sewer which is connected with the general
sewerage system of the City.
   (e)   "Plumber" means a person who is the holder of a license duly issued in
accordance with the provisions of the Plumbing License Law of Illinois,
designating such person as a "licensed plumber."
   (f)   "Private sewer" means any main or branch sewer located either on
public or private property, not constructed or accepted by the City, which
conveys the drainage of one or more buildings or sites to the sewer system of
the City, or its outlet.
   (g)   "Sewer" means all work and material in installing, connecting or
repairing any system of drainage whereby foul, waste or surplus matter is
discharged through a pipe from a building or fixture to the main sewer, or to
any other point of disposal.
(1977 Code §6-202; Ord. 89-12. Passed 4-17-89; Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04;
Ord. 2011-21. Passed 5-2-11.)
1422.03 APPLICATION OF CODE.
   The Illinois Plumbing Code, as adopted in Section
1422.01, shall be applicable to all buildings, structures and improvements in
the City.
(Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04; Ord. 2011-21. Passed 5-2-11.)
1422.04 FILE COPIES.
   At least one copy of the Illinois Plumbing Code, as adopted in Section
1422.01, shall be kept on file in the office of the Building Commissioner, and
there kept available for public use, inspection and examination.
(Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04; Ord. 2011-21. Passed 5-2-11; Ord. 2013-10. Passed
3-4-13.)
1422.05 CONFLICT OF LAWS.
   (a)   In the event of a conflict between any of the provisions of the
Illinois Plumbing Code, as adopted in Section
1422.01, and any provision of these Codified Ordinances, or any other local
ordinance or resolution, the local provision shall control.
   (b)   In the event of a conflict between any of the provisions of such Code
and a provision of any other technical code adopted or referred to by the City
as a standard, the higher or stricter standard shall control.
(Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04; Ord. 2011-21. Passed 5-2-11.)
1422.06 VIOLATIONS; ABATEMENT; SEPARATE OFFENSES.
   (a)   No person shall erect, construct, occupy or maintain any building or
other structure in violation of any of the provisions of the Illinois Plumbing
Code, as adopted in Section
1422.01, or cause, permit or suffer any such violation to be committed.
   (b)   It is the responsibility of the offender to abate the violation as
expeditiously as possible, and each day during which such violation is
permitted to continue shall constitute a separate offense.
(Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04; Ord. 2011-21. Passed 5-2-11.)
1422.07 FEES.
   Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the Illinois Plumbing Code, as
adopted in Section
1422.01, fees to be charged for inspections and issuance of plumbing permits
shall be as specified in
Chapter 1442 of these Codified Ordinances.
(Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04; Ord. 2011-21. Passed 5-2-11.)
1422.08 PLANNING, DESIGNING AND INSTALLING PLUMBING SYSTEMS.
   All planning and designing of plumbing systems, and all plumbing, shall be
performed only by a plumber, provided that no person who holds a certificate of
registration provided by the Illinois Architecture Practice Act of 1989 (225
ILCS 301/1 et seq., as amended), the Structural Engineering Licensing Act of
1989 (225 ILCS 340/1 et seq., as amended), or the Professional Engineering
Practice Act of 1989 (225 ILCS 325/1 et seq., as amended), shall be prevented
from planning and designing plumbing systems.
(1977 Code § 6-203; Ord. 89-12. Passed 4-17-89.)
1422.09 APPRENTICES.
   No person shall engage in plumbing as an apprentice unless he or she has
registered in accordance with the Illinois Plumbing License Law (225 ILCS 320/
0.01 et seq., as amended) as a plumber's apprentice. No plumber shall employ
any person as an apprentice who is not so registered.
(1977 Code § 6-204; Ord. 89-12. Passed 4-17-89.)
1422.10 REGISTRATION OF PLUMBING CONTRACTORS; FEES; DISPLAY OF LICENSE;
LIABILITY INSURANCE.
   Each plumbing contractor shall provide a copy of his or her State Plumber’s
License and State Plumbing Contractor’s License upon application for any permit
subject to this section. At least one member of every firm, association or
partnership engaged in plumbing work, and at least one corporate officer of
every corporation engaged in plumbing work, shall be a plumber. Every such
firm, association, partnership or corporation shall keep on display in its
place of business the license of at least one of its members, partners or
officers. The Building Commissioner shall post, in a conspicuous location in
City Hall, the current license rate. The license applicant shall be responsible
for obtaining liability insurance with minimum general liability limits of at
least one million dollars ($1,000,000) per occurrence for bodily injury and
property damage. The license applicant shall provide the Building Commissioner
with evidence of obtaining such insurance prior to registration. This insurance
requirement is a continuing requirement for registration. Failure to maintain
insurance shall result in cancellation of the registration by the Building
Commissioner.
(Ord. 92-21. Passed 7-6-92; Ord. 2011-21. Passed 5-2-11; Ord. 2018-52. Passed
11-5-18.)
1422.11 PERMIT REQUIRED; EXCEPTIONS.
   A permit is required for all plumbing, except for the repair of leaks and
the connection of domestic appliances where facilities for such connections
already exist.
(1977 Code § 6-206; Ord. 89-12. Passed 4-17-89.)
1422.12 INSTALLATION OF WATER SOFTENERS. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Section 1422.12 was repealed by Ordinance No. 2018-52,
passed November 5, 2018.)
1422.13 HOUSE SEWERS.
   Each principal building (as defined in Section
1240.06(30) of the Planning and Zoning Code) hereafter constructed shall have a
separate house sewer. If thermoplastic sewer pipe or flexible thermoplastic
sewer pipe is used, there shall be backfill to twelve inches over the top of
the pipe in accordance with ASTM D2321 restricted to Class I, II or III
embedment materials. Fill materials shall be one-quarter inch to one and one-
half inch graded stone, coarse sands and gravel with a maximum particle size of
one and one-half inches, or fine sands and clayey gravels. The pipe must be
bedded true to line and grade with uniform and continuous support from a firm
base. Blocking shall not be used to bring the pipe to grade.
(1977 Code § 6-210; Ord. 89-12. Passed 4-17-89.)
1422.14 WATER SUPPLY SERVICE.
   (a)   The house service from the curb cock to the building shall:
      (1)   Have a diameter of not less than one inch copper tubing size (CTS);
      (2)   Have a minimum 200 pounds per square inch (psi) rating;
      (3)   Include a tracer wire with minimum specifications of 12 gauge solid
coated copper in the case of nonmetallic services; and
      (4)   Shall otherwise meet all standards of the Illinois Plumbing Code.
   (b)   In the case of an existing structure, if a metallic service is being
replaced by a non-metallic service, and the metallic service had served as the
electrical ground for the structure:
      (1)   The pipe from the existing metallic service may continue to serve
as electrical ground, provided a length of at least twenty feet remain
attached; or
      (2)   A new electrical ground is established prior to disconnection of
the existing metallic service pipe.
(Ord. 99-67. Passed 12-6-99; Ord. 2006-58a. Passed 10-2-06.)
1422.15 INCORPORATION OF RELEVANT STATUTORY PROVISIONS; CONFLICTS.
   All applicable provisions of the Illinois Plumbing License Law (225 ILCS
320/0.01 et seq.) are incorporated herein by reference, the same as though set
forth at length herein, provided that any of the provisions of this chapter
which are more restrictive than the provisions of the aforesaid State statute
shall apply.
1422.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
202.99 for general Code penalty if no specific penalty is provided.)

insurance.

   CROSS REFERENCES
   Adoption of electrical wiring code by municipalities by reference - see 50
ILCS 220/0.01 et seq.; 65 ILCS 5/1-3-1 et seq.
   Cogeneration of electricity by municipalities - see 220 ILCS 5/8-403
   Electricity in mobile home parks - see B.R. & T.
846.09,

1068.09

1424.01 EDITION ADOPTED.
   For the purpose of prescribing regulations governing the installation,
construction, alteration, repair and maintenance of electrical systems and
equipment, that certain document marked and designated as the National
Electrical Code, 2017 edition, as promulgated by the National Fire Protection
Association, is hereby adopted as the Electrical Code of the City, save and
except for such portions thereof as may be amended or repealed in this chapter.
(Ord. 96-04. Passed 1-16-96; Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04; Ord. 2011-22. Passed
5-2-11; Ord. 2013-40. Passed 9-3-13; Ord. 2021-43. Passed 9-20-21.)
1424.02 APPLICATION OF CODE.
   The National Electrical Code, as adopted in Section
1424.01, shall be applicable to all buildings, structures and improvements in
the City.
1424.03 FILE COPIES.
   At least one copy of the National Electrical Code, as adopted in Section
1424.01, shall be kept on file in the office of the Building Commissioner and
there kept available for public use, inspection and examination.
(Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04; Ord. 2011-22. Passed 5-2-11; Ord. 2013-10. Passed
3-4-13.)
1424.04 CONFLICT OF LAWS.
   (a)   In the event of a conflict between any of the provisions of the
National Electrical Code, as adopted in Section
1424.01, and any provision of these Codified Ordinances, or any other local
ordinance or resolution, the local provision shall control.
   (b)   In the event of a conflict between any of the provisions of such Code
and a provision of any other technical code adopted or referred to by the City
as a standard, the higher or stricter standard shall control.
1424.05 VIOLATIONS; ABATEMENT; SEPARATE OFFENSES.
   (a)   No person shall erect, use, occupy or maintain any building or
structure in violation of any of the provisions of the National Electrical
Code, as adopted in Section
1424.01, or cause, permit or suffer any such violation to be committed.
   (b)   It is the responsibility of the offender to abate the violation as
expeditiously as possible, and each day during which such violation is
permitted to continue shall constitute a separate offense.
1424.06 FEES.
   Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the National Electrical Code, as
adopted in Section
1424.01, fees to be charged for inspections and issuance of electrical permits
shall be as specified in
Chapter 1442 of these Codified Ordinances.
1424.07 ELECTRICAL EQUIPMENT DEFINED.
   As used in this chapter, "electrical equipment" means conductors and other
equipment installed for the utilization of electricity for light, heat or
power. It does not include radio apparatus or equipment for wireless reception
of sounds and signals, nor apparatus, conductors, or other equipment installed
for or by public utilities, including common carriers, which are under the
jurisdiction of the Illinois Commerce Commission, for use in their operation as
public utilities.
(1977 Code § 6-402; Ord. 89-12. Passed 4-17-89.)
1424.08 PERMIT REQUIRED; EXCEPTIONS.
   A permit is required for the installation or alteration of electrical
equipment, except for minor maintenance and repair such as cleaning and oiling
motors, replacing fuses, switches, lampholders and motors and repairing cords.
(1977 Code § 6-403; Ord. 89-12. Passed 4-17-89.)
1424.09 REGISTERED SUPERVISING ELECTRICIANS; LICENSE FEE; LIABILITY INSURANCE.
   (a)   No person shall perform electrical work as a contractor unless he or
she is, or has in his or her employ, a registered supervising electrician.
   (b)   A registered supervising electrician shall be a high school graduate
or shall have the equivalent of a high school education, shall have had at
least five years experience in the installation, alteration, repair and
maintenance of electrical wires, equipment and apparatus, or an experience
equivalent thereto, and shall pass an examination. The initial annual license
fee for the electrical contractor shall be two hundred ninety-four dollars
($294.00). The license shall be renewed annually at a cost of one hundred
forty-seven dollars ($147.00). Such fees shall be increased by seven percent on
May 1 of each year. The Building Commissioner shall post, in a conspicuous
location in City Hall, the current fee. The license applicant shall be
responsible for obtaining liability insurance with minimum general liability
limits of at least one million dollars ($1,000,000) per occurrence for bodily
injury and property damage. The license applicant shall provide the Building
Commissioner with evidence of obtaining such insurance prior to the issuance of
a license. This insurance requirement is a continuing requirement for
licensure. Failure to maintain insurance shall result in cancellation of the
license by the Building Commissioner.
   (c)   An applicant for a registered supervising electrician license must
pass an examination administered by the Building Commissioner as a condition of
licensure. The Building Commissioner shall notify the applicant of the time and
place of examination and shall, within thirty days after application, examine
the applicant as to his or her qualifications and competency to be a registered
supervising electrician.
   (d)   The examination shall cover all phases of the electrical work covered
by the National Electrical Code.
   (e)   The certificate of a registered supervising electrician may be renewed
from year to year without examination, upon a completed application with all
necessary accompanying documents being filed prior to the date of expiration.
   (f)   Upon the expiration of a continuous two-year period during which a
registered supervising electrician has not acted in such capacity, he or she
shall be re-examined as provided herein before he or she shall be again
certified as a registered supervising electrician.
   (g)   A corporation, partnership or firm which contracts for electrical work
shall have as one of its corporate officers, partners or owners, as the case
may be, a registered supervising electrician, or shall have in its employ on
the particular job a registered supervising electrician.
   (h)   Upon proper registration, a certificate of registration shall be given
to the applicant. Such certificate shall expire on December 31 of the year in
which it is issued. Renewal certificates shall be issued by the Building
Commissioner during the months of November and December, upon application.
   (i)   All registration certificates shall be issued to individuals only and
not to partnerships, firms or corporations. The certificates shall not be
transferable.
   (j)   No registrant shall allow his or her name to be used by another person
for the purpose of doing business or work under the registration.
   (k)   The Building Commissioner may revoke any registration obtained through
nondisclosure, misstatement or misrepresentation of a material fact, or if the
registrant violates any provision of this chapter. There shall be no refund of
any portion of the fee upon revocation.
(1977 Code §6-406; Ord. 89-12. Passed 4-17-89; Ord. 92-21. Passed 7-6-92; Ord.
93-2. Passed 1-19-93; Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04; Ord. 2011-22. Passed 5-2-
11.)
1424.10 RECIPROCITY.
   A license issued by any municipality or governmental body other than the
City shall not be accepted or recognized in lieu of the license required by
Section
1424.09.
(Ord. 94-104. Passed 12-19-94.)
1424.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
202.99 for general Code penalty if no specific penalty is provided.)
CHAPTER 1425
Illinois Energy Conservation Code
1425.01   Edition adopted.
1425.02   Application of Code.

1425.01   EDITION ADOPTED.
   The State of Illinois has elected to supercede the authority of local
governments to independently regulate those aspects of construction and
building specification which pertain to energy efficiency by enacting the
Illinois Energy Conservation Code, 71 Ill. Admin. Code pt. 600. As such, the
current version of the Illinois Energy Conservation Code in force as of the
date of inspection of any work to be permitted hereunder, is hereby adopted as
the Energy Conservation Code of the City, and any prior version in effect, if
any, of same are specifically repealed at this time.
(Ord. 2011-23. Passed 5-2-11; Ord. 2013-40. Passed 9-3-13; Ord. 2018-52. Passed
11-5-18.)
1425.02   APPLICATION OF CODE.
   The Illinois Energy Conservation Code, as adopted in Section
1425.01 , shall be applicable to all buildings, structures and improvements in
the City.
(Ord. 2011-23. Passed 5-2-11; Ord. 2018-52. Passed 11-5-18.)
1425.03   FILE COPY.
   At least one copy of the Illinois Energy Conservation Code, as adopted in
Section
1425.01 , shall be kept on file, one in the office of the Building Commissioner
and there kept available for public use, inspection and examination.
(Ord. 2011-23. Passed 5-2-11; Ord. 2013-10. Passed 3-4-13; Ord. 2018-52. Passed
11-5-18.)
1425.04   CONFLICT OF LAWS.
   (a)   In the event of a conflict between any of the provisions of the
Illinois Energy Conservation Code, as adopted in Section
1425.01 , and any provision of these Codified Ordinances, or any other local
ordinance or resolution, the local provision shall control, unless said
conflict pertains to the installation of any building component which is
subject to the Illinois Energy Conservation Code, in which case said Code shall
prevail.
   (b)   In the event of a conflict between any of the provisions of such Code
and a provision of any other technical code adopted or referred to by the City
as a standard, the higher or stricter standard shall control.
(Ord. 2011-23. Passed 5-2-11; Ord. 2018-52. Passed 11-5-18.)
1425.05   VIOLATIONS; ABATEMENT; SEPARATE OFFENSES.
   (a)   No person shall erect, use, occupy or maintain any building or
structure in violation of any of the provisions of the Illinois Energy
Conservation Code, as adopted in Section
1425.01 , or cause, permit or suffer any such violation to be committed.
   (b)   It is the responsibility of the offender to abate the violation as
expeditiously as possible, and each day during which such violation is
permitted to continue shall constitute a separate offense.
(Ord. 2011-23. Passed 5-2-11; Ord. 2018-52. Passed 11-5-18.)
1425.06   FEES.
   Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the Illinois Energy Conservation
Code, as adopted in Section
1425.01 , fees to be charged for inspections and issuance of permits shall be
as specified in
Chapter 1442  of these Codified Ordinances.
(Ord. 2011-23. Passed 5-2-11; Ord. 2018-52. Passed 11-5-18.)
1425.07   PERMIT REQUIRED.
   A permit is required in order to install, erect, alter, repair, service or
replace any system to which the Illinois Energy Conservation Code applies.
(Ord. 2011-23. Passed 5-2-11; Ord. 2018-52. Passed 11-5-18.)
1425.08   LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person, firm or corporation shall install, erect, alter, repair, service
or replace any system to which the International Energy Conservation Code
applies unless said person or some member of such firm or corporation shall
first have obtained a license as required under this Building Code.
(Ord. 2011-23. Passed 5-2-11.)

hereby incorporated herein by reference, subject to the provisions of Section
202.05(b) of the Administration Code.
(Ord. 2011-23. Passed 5-2-11.)

that certain document marked and designated as the International Mechanical
Code, (2018), as promulgated by International Code Council, Inc., is hereby
adopted as the Mechanical Code of the City, save and except for such portions
thereof as may be amended or repealed in this chapter, and any prior versions
in effect, if any, of same are specifically repealed at this time. Whenever
referenced herein, the "International Mechanical Code" or "IMC" shall refer to
the version thereof adopted by the City, including any amendments thereto
adopted by the City.
(Ord. 96-73. Passed 10-7-96; Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04; Ord. 2010-11. Passed
2-16-10; Ord. 2011-24. Passed 5-2-11; Ord. 2013-40. Passed 9-3-13; Ord. 2024-
37. Passed 8-5-24.)
1426.02 APPLICATION OF CODE; AMENDMENTS.
   The International Mechanical Code, as adopted in Section
1426.01, shall be applicable to all buildings, structures and improvements in
the City. The International Existing Building Code, as adopted in Section
1429.01, is hereby amended as follows:
   Subsection 301.19 Gas Meter is hereby ADDED as follows:
      Subsection 301.19 Gas Meter. Where gas meters and/or metering equipment
are subject to vehicular damage, suitable barriers shall be installed to assure
total protection. This protection shall be approved by the authority having
jurisdiction.
   Subsection 301.20 Identification is hereby ADDED as follows:
      Subsection 301.20 Identification. Where gas meters or electrical meters
are installed in banks or series of meters serving more than one occupancy, the
individual meters shall be marked indicating the address or area being served.
These markings shall be permanent and not subject to weather deterioration.
   Subsection 603.19 Return Air is hereby ADDED as follows:
      Subsection 603.19 Return Air. In all residential use groups, individual
return air opening(s) shall be provided in each bedroom and shall comply with
Chapter 6.
(Ord. 2024-37. Passed 8-5-24.).
1426.03 FILE COPIES.
   At least one copy of the International Mechanical Code, as adopted in
Section
1426.01, shall be kept on file in the office of the Building Commissioner and
there kept available for public use, inspection and examination.
(Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04; Ord. 2011-24. Passed 5-2-11; Ord. 2013-10. Passed
3-4-13.)

   (a)   In the event of a conflict between any of the provisions of the

1426.07 PERMIT REQUIRED.
   A permit is required for the construction, installation, extension or
alteration of a central warm air heating system or a central air conditioning
system.
(1977 Code § 6-303; Ord. 89-12. Passed 4-17-89.)
1426.08 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person, firm or corporation shall install, erect, alter, repair, service
or replace any warm air heating or air conditioning system, or parts or
appurtenances thereto, unless said person or some member of such firm or
corporation shall first have obtained a warm air heating and air conditioning
license hereunder, or unless such person, firm or corporation has regularly and
steadily in his or her employ a holder of such warm air heating and air
conditioning license, who shall be the authorized representative of the person,
firm or corporation in all matters pertaining to this chapter. Such authorized
representative may not apply for permits for more than one person, firm or
corporation.
(1977 Code § 6-304; Ord. 89-12. Passed 4-17-89.)
1426.09 RESPONSIBILITY FOR VIOLATIONS.
   In the case of a person, firm or corporation employing a warm air heating
and air conditioning license holder, both said employer and the license holder
shall be responsible for all violations under this chapter.
(1977 Code § 6-305; Ord. 89-12. Passed 4-17-89.)
1426.10 ELIGIBILITY OF LICENSEES.
   An applicant for a warm air heating and air conditioning license shall have
had at least five years practical experience in warm air heating and air
conditioning.
(Ord. 92-21. Passed 7-6-92.)
1426.11 ISSUANCE OF LICENSE; FEE; EFFECTIVE PERIOD.
   An applicant, having fully complied with the provisions of this chapter, and
having successfully passed an examination of the Building Commissioner, shall,
upon a favorable recommendation of the Building Commissioner after a review of
the applicant's qualifications, as provided for in this chapter, be issued a
license under this chapter upon the payment of a license fee of two hundred
ninety-four dollars ($294.00) for a period of time expiring on the next
succeeding December 31.
(Ord. 92-77. Passed 12-7-92; Ord. 2004-32. Passed 6-7-04; Ord. 2011-24. Passed
5-2-11.)
1426.12 LICENSEES; TRANSFERS.
   The license herein provided for shall be issued only to an individual, and
not to a corporation or firm, and such licenses shall not be transferable.
(1977 Code § 6-308; Ord. 89-12. Passed 4-17-89.)
1426.13 RENEWAL OF LICENSE; FEE; LIABILITY INSURANCE. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: Section 1426.13 was repealed by Ordinance 2011-26, passed
May 2, 2011.)
1426.14 INCORPORATION OF RELEVANT STATUTORY PROVISIONS; CONFLICTS.
   All pertinent and applicable provisions of 65 ILCS 5/11-32-1 et seq. are
hereby incorporated herein by reference, subject to the provisions of Section
202.05(b) of the Administration Code.
1426.15 RECIPROCITY.
   A license issued by any municipality or governmental body other than the
City shall not be accepted or recognized in lieu of the license required by
Section
1426.08.
(1977 Code § 6-311; Ord. 89-12. Passed 4-17-89.)

   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
202.99 for general Code penalty if no specific penalty is provided.)

Illinois Boiler and Pressure Vessel Safety Act
1428.01   Edition adopted.
1428.02   Application of Act and Rules and Regulations.
1428.03   File copies.
1428.04   Conflict of laws.
1428.05   Violations; abatement; separate offenses.
1428.06   Fees.
1428.07   Permit required.
1428.08   Registration of contractors; fee; liability insurance.
1428.09   Incorporation of relevant statutory provisions; conflicts.
1428.99   Penalty.
   CROSS REFERENCES
   Municipal regulation of boilers - see 65 ILCS 5/11-8-2
   Boilers - see 430 ILCS 75/1 et seq.
   Special permits for new boilers and pressure vessels - see 430 ILCS 75/3
   Liability for damage to boilers - see S.U. & P.S.
1042.21
   Boiler permits - see B. & H.
1442.17
1428.01 EDITION ADOPTED.
   For the purpose of prescribing regulations governing the installation,
construction, alteration, repair and maintenance of boilers, except such
boilers as are exempt under the Code, the Boiler and Pressure Vessel Safety Act
(430 ILCS 75/1 et seq.), and Rules and Regulations published in relation
thereto in 41 Ill. Admin. Code, Part 2120, are hereby adopted, save and except
for such portions thereof as may be amended or repealed in this chapter.
(Ord. 96-05. Passed 1-16-96; Ord. 2013-40. Passed 9-3-13; Ord. 2018-52. Passed
11-5-18.)
1428.02 APPLICATION OF ACT AND RULES AND REGULATIONS.
   The Boiler and Pressure Vessel Safety Act and Rules and Regulations, as
adopted in Section
1428.01, shall apply to the installation, construction, maintenance and repair
of all boilers covered by such Act and Rules and Regulations. The construction,
installation, maintenance and repair of all boilers exempt under such Act and
Rules and Regulations shall be governed by the pertinent provisions of
Chapter 1422. The pertinent provisions of
Chapter 1422, and all other applicable codes, including electrical, mechanical,
energy and plumbing codes, as adopted herein, shall apply to and govern the
installation, repair and maintenance of all appurtenances to any water or steam
boiler, whether such boiler is subject to, or exempt from, the Boiler and
Pressure Vessel Safety Act and Rules and Regulations.
(1977 Code §6-503; Ord. 89-12. Passed 4-17-89; Ord. 2018-52. Passed 11-5-18.)
1428.03 FILE COPIES.
   At least three copies of the Boiler and Pressure Vessel Safety Act and Rules
and Regulations, as adopted in Section
1428.01, shall be kept on file in the office of the City Clerk, and there kept
available for public use, inspection and examination.
1428.04 CONFLICT OF LAWS.
   (a)   In the event of a conflict between any of the provisions of the Boiler
and Pressure Vessel Safety Act and Rules and Regulations, as adopted in Section
1428.01, and any provision of these Codified Ordinances, or any other local
ordinance or resolution, the local provision shall control.
   (b)   In the event of a conflict between any of the provisions of such Act
and Rules and Regulations and a provision of any other technical code adopted
or referred to by the City as a standard, the higher or stricter standard shall
control.
1428.05 VIOLATIONS; ABATEMENT; SEPARATE OFFENSES.
   (a)   No person shall construct, install, extend or alter any boiler in
violation of any of the provisions of the Boiler and Pressure Vessel Safety Act
and Rules and Regulations, as adopted in Section
1428.01, or cause, permit or suffer any such violation to be committed.
   (b)   It is the responsibility of the offender to abate the violation as
expeditiously as possible, and each day during which such violation is
permitted to continue shall constitute a separate offense.
1428.06 FEES.
   Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the Boiler and Pressure Vessel
Safety Act and Rules and Regulations, as adopted in Section
1428.01, fees to be charged for inspections and issuance of building permits
shall be as specified in
Chapter 1442 of these Codified Ordinances.
1428.07 PERMIT REQUIRED.
   A permit is required for the construction, installation, extension or
alteration of a boiler, whether it is subject to or exempt from the Boiler and
Pressure Vessel Safety Act and Rules and Regulations, or the appurtenant water
or steam distribution lines of a boiler.
(1977 Code § 6-504; Ord. 89-12. Passed 4-17-89.)
1428.08 REGISTRATION OF CONTRACTORS; FEE; LIABILITY INSURANCE.
   Each boiler contractor, who is not registered as a plumber under
Chapter 1422, shall register as a commercial contractor, in each calendar year,
with the Community Development Director, and shall pay an annual registration
fee of fifty dollars ($50.00). The license applicant shall be responsible for
obtaining liability insurance in amounts and coverage type appropriate for the
applicant's individual business circumstances. The license applicant shall
provide the Building Commissioner with evidence of obtaining such insurance
prior to the issuance of a license. This insurance requirement is a continuing
requirement for licensure. Failure to maintain insurance shall result in
cancellation of the license by the Building Commissioner.
(Ord. 92-21. Passed 7-6-92; Ord. 2018-52. Passed 11-5-18.)
1428.09 INCORPORATION OF RELEVANT STATUTORY PROVISIONS; CONFLICTS.
   All applicable provisions of the Boiler and Pressure Vessel Safety Act (430
ILCS 75/1 et seq.), as amended from time to time, are incorporated herein and
made a part hereof by reference, the same as though set forth at length herein,
subject to the provisions of Section
202.05(b) of the Administration Code.
1428.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
202.99 for general Code penalty if no specific penalty is provided.)
CHAPTER 1429
International Existing Building Code

1429.01 EDITION ADOPTED.
   For the purpose of prescribing regulations governing the repair or
alteration of existing buildings, that certain document marked and designated
as the International Existing Building Code, (2018), as promulgated by the
International Code Council, is hereby adopted as the Existing Building Code of
the City. Whenever referenced herein, the "International Existing Building
Code" or "IEBC" shall refer to the version thereof adopted by the City,
including any amendments thereto adopted by the City.
(Ord. 2012-31. Passed 5-21-12; Ord. 2013-40. Passed 9-3-13; Ord. 2024-37.
Passed 8-5-24.)
1429.02 APPLICATION OF CODE.
   The International Mechanical Code, as adopted in Section 1426.01, is hereby
amended as follows:
   Subsection 104.1.1 Fire Official Approval is hereby ADDED as follows:
      104.1.1 Fire Official Approval- The Fire Chief for the City of Freeport
and/or-his/her designee shall have the authority to issue orders based on
requirements of this code for matters pertaining to design, materials or
equipment when related to fire protection.
   Subsection 106.3 Plan Approval is hereby amended as follows (additions shown
as underlines and deletions as strikethroughs):
      106.3 Examination of documents. The code official shall examine or cause
to be examined submittal documents and shall ascertain by such examinations
whether the construction or occupancy indicated and described is in accordance
with the requirements of this code and other pertinent laws or ordinances. The
Fire Department may review all plans for issuance of building, fire suppression
and fire alarm (electrical) permits. Copies of the plans will be provided to
the Fire Department Administration Offices. If the plans do not conform to the
requirements set forth by this code, they may be rejected by the Fire
Department pursuant to Section 112 of this code.
   Subsection 803.2 Automatic Sprinkler Systems is hereby amended as follows
(additions shown as underlines and deletions as strikethroughs):
      803.2 Automatic sprinkler systems. Automatic sprinkler systems shall be
provided in accordance with the requirements of Sections 803.2.1 through
803.2.4 Installation requirements shall be in accordance with the International
Building Code.
         Exception. Automatic sprinkler systems shall not be required in any
building or portion of a building that currently exists in either the Downtown
Business District or Downtown Historic District, unless otherwise ordered by
the Fire Chief.
   Subsection 803.3 Standpipes is hereby amended as follows (additions shown as
underlines and deletions as strikethroughs):
      803.3 Standpipes. Where the work area includes exits or corridors shared
by more than one tenant and is located more than 50 feet (15 240 mm) above or
below the lowest level of fire department access, a standpipe system shall be
provided. Standpipes shall have an approved fire department connection with
hose connections at each floor level above or below the lowest level of fire
department access. Standpipe systems shall be installed in accordance with the
International Building Code.
         Exceptions:
         1.   A pump shall not be required provided that the standpipes are
capable of accepting delivery by fire department apparatus of not less than 250
gallons per minute (gpm) at 65 pounds per square inch (psi) (946 L/m at 448KPa)
to the topmost floor in buildings equipped throughout with an automatic
sprinkler system or not less than 500 gpm at 65 psi (1892 L/m at 448KPa) to the
topmost floor in all other buildings. Where the standpipe terminates below the
topmost floor, the standpipe shall be designed to meet (gpm/psi) (L/m/KPa)
requirements of this exception for possible future extension of the standpipe.
         2.   he interconnection of multiple standpipe risers shall not be
required.
         3.   Standpipe systems shall not be required in any building or
portion of a building that currently exists in either the Downtown Business
District or Downtown Historic District, unless otherwise ordered by the Fire
Chief.
   Subsection 904.1 Automatic Sprinkler Systems is hereby amended as follows
(additions shown as underlines and deletions as strikethroughs):
      904.1 Automatic Sprinkler Systems. An automatic sprinkler system shall be
provided in a work area where required by Section 803.2 or this section.
         Exception. Automatic sprinkler systems shall not be required in any
building or portion of a building that currently exists in either the Downtown
Business District or Downtown Historic District, unless otherwise ordered by
the Fire Chief.
   Subsection 1004.1 General is hereby amended as follows (additions shown as
underlines and deletions as strikethroughs):
      1004.1 General. Fire protection requirements of Section 1011 shall apply
where a building or portions thereof undergo a change of occupancy
classification or where there is a change of occupancy within a space where
there is a different fire protection system threshold requirement in Chapter 9
of the International Building Code.
         Exception. Fire protection requirements of Section 1011 shall not
apply in any building or portion of a building that currently exists in either
the Downtown Business District or Downtown Historic District, unless otherwise
ordered by the Fire Chief.
(Ord. 2012-31. Passed 5-21-12; Ord. 2024-37. Passed 8-5-24; Ord. 2024-58.
Passed 11-4-24.)

and there kept available for public use, inspection and examination.

1429.04 CONFLICT OF LAWS.
   (a)   In the event of a conflict between any of the provisions of the
International Existing Building Code, as adopted in Section
1429.01, and any provision of these Codified Ordinances, or any other local
ordinance or resolution, the local provision shall control.
   (b)   In the event of a conflict between any of the provisions of such Code
and a provision of any other technical code adopted or referred to by the City
as a standard, the higher or stricter standard shall control.
(Ord. 2012-31. Passed 5-21-12.)
1429.05 VIOLATIONS; ABATEMENT; SEPARATE OFFENSES.
   (a)   No person shall erect, use, occupy or maintain any building or
structure in violation of any of the provisions of the International Existing
Building Code, as adopted in Section
1429.01, or cause, permit or suffer any such violation to be committed.
   (b)   It is the responsibility of the offender to abate the violation as
expeditiously as possible, and each day during which such violation is
permitted to continue shall constitute a separate offense.
(Ord. 2012-31. Passed 5-21-12.)
1429.06 FEES.
   Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the International Existing
Building Code, as adopted in Section
1429.01, fees to be charged for inspections and issuance of permits shall be as
specified in
Chapter 1442 of these Codified Ordinances.
(Ord. 2012-31. Passed 5-21-12.)
1429.07 PERMIT REQUIRED.
   A permit is required for the alteration or repair of existing buildings.
(Ord. 2012-31. Passed 5-21-12.)
1429.08 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person, firm or corporation shall alter, repair or service any existing
building said person or some member of such firm or corporation shall first
have obtained a license as required under this Building Code.
(Ord. 2012-31. Passed 5-21-12.)
